definitions.definition: having a baby or young animal developing inside her/its body
definitions.labels: (especially US English)(especially North American English)(especially British English)(British English)(North American English)(especially British English)

examples.text: I was pregnant with our third child at the time.
a **heavily pregnant** woman *(= one whose baby is nearly ready to be born)*
He got his girlfriend pregnant and they're getting married.
I discovered my cat was pregnant.
She was pregnant by a former boyfriend.
My sister is pregnant with twins.

phrases: six weeks, three months, etc. pregnant

definitions.definition: full of a quality or feeling

examples.text: Her silences were pregnant with criticism.

definitions.definition: an occasion when nobody speaks, although people are aware that there are feelings or thoughts to express

examples.text: There was a pregnant pause before she replied.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin praegnant-, probably from prae ‘before’ + the base of gnasci ‘be born’.
